summary: This is a motion filed by Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team requesting court authorization to subpoena documents from the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program. The motion argues that the four accusers in Maxwell's indictment received millions from the fund, and their compensation claims and related documents are critical for impeachment at trial to show potential bias and motive for fabrication.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case, charged with conspiracy and sex trafficking related to Jeffrey Epstein. Her defense team is filing this motion to subpoena victim compensation records.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, signed the motion and is listed as counsel from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

persons.name: Laura A. Menninger
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel from HADDON, MORGAN & FOREMAN P.C.

persons.name: Christian R. Everdell
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel from COHEN & GRESSER LLP.

persons.name: Bobbi C. Stemheim
persons.context: Attorney for Ghislaine Maxwell, listed as counsel from Law Offices of Bobbi C. Stemheim.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the central figure in the sex trafficking conspiracy. The motion notes that the June 2019 indictment against him did not include the allegations of the four accusers in Maxwell's case.

connections.description: The indictment alleges Maxwell conspired with Epstein to recruit minors for commercial sex acts.
Pagliuca is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys filing this motion on her behalf.
Menninger is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys listed on the motion.
Everdell is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys listed on the motion.
Stemheim is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys listed on the motion.

events.title: Government Begins 3500 Material Production
events.description: The government began producing discovery material (3500 material) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, which included information about accusers receiving compensation.

events.title: Indictment Against Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was indicted in June 2019. The motion notes this indictment did not include the allegations of the four accusers who are part of Maxwell's S2 Indictment.

events.title: Court Conference on Witness Designation
events.description: A court conference was held where the court ruled on referring to one individual as 'Witness-3' instead of 'Accuser-3'.

locations: UNITED STATES DISTRICT COURT SOUTHERN DISTRICT OF NEW YORK
U.S. Attorney's Office, SDNY One Saint Andrew's Plaza New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense is seeking to subpoena documents from the Epstein Victim's Compensation Program to impeach the four accusers at her trial.
The four accusers (referred to as Accuser-1, Accuser-2, Accuser-4, and Witness-3) received substantial payments from the fund: $5M, $1.5M, $3.5M, and $3.25M respectively.
The defense argues the compensation protocol rewards claimants if prosecutions against Epstein's employees (like Maxwell) move forward, creating a financial motive for the accusers' testimony.
The motion claims the June 2019 indictment against Jeffrey Epstein did not include the allegations made by these four accusers in Maxwell's case.
Lawyers for Accuser-2 and Witness-3 were reportedly instrumental in creating the terms of the victim compensation protocol.
